question: Who of the following gave the idea of ‘Saintly Idiom’ in Indian politics?
explanation: Back in the 1950s, the British scholar W.H. Morris Jones identified three idioms of Indian politics. These were the modern, the traditional and the Saintly. Thus, he wrote, “The modern language of politics is the language of the Indian constitution and the courts; of parliamentary debates; of the higher administration.” Back in the 1950s, the British scholar W.H.
